create_spoiler.tooltip: Enabling this will change the seed.

compress_rom.tooltip:
The first time compressed generation will take a while,
but subsequent generations will be quick. It is highly
recommended to compress or the game will crash
frequently except on real N64 hardware.

Patch files are used to send the patched data to other
people without sending the ROM file.

multiworld_section.subheader:
This is used for co_op generations. Increasing Player Count will drastically increase the generation time.
For more information, see:
https://github.com/TestRunnerSRL/bizhawk_co_op

presets.tooltip: Select a setting preset to apply.

preset_section.subheader:
Presets are settings that can be saved and loaded from.
Loading a preset will overwrite all settings that affect the seed.

open_forest.tooltip:
Open Forest: Mido no longer blocks the path to the
Deku Tree, and the Kokiri boy no longer blocks the path
out of the forest.

Closed Deku: The Kokiri boy no longer blocks the path
out of the forest, but Mido still blocks the path to the
Deku Tree, requiring Kokiri Sword and Deku Shield to access
the Deku Tree.

Closed Forest: The Kokiri Sword and Slingshot are always
available somewhere in the forest. This is incompatible with
Start as Adult and shuffling "All Indoors" and/or "Overworld"
entrances will force this to Closed Deku if selected.

open_door_of_time.tooltip:
The Door of Time starts opened instead of needing to
play the Song of Time. If this is not set, only
an Ocarina and Song of Time must be found to open
the Door of Time.

open_fountain.tooltip:
King Zora starts out as moved. This also removes
Ruto's Letter from the item pool.

gerudo_fortress.tooltip:
'Rescue One Carpenter': Only the bottom left
carpenter must be rescued.

'Open Gerudo Fortress': The carpenters are rescued from
the start of the game, and if 'Shuffle Gerudo Card' is disabled,
the player starts with the Gerudo Card in the inventory
allowing access to Gerudo Training Grounds.

bridge.tooltip:
'Always Open': Rainbow Bridge is always present.
'Vanilla Requirements': Spirit/Shadow Medallions and Light Arrows.
'All Spiritual Stones': All 3 Spiritual Stones.
'All Medallions': All 6 Medallions.
'All Dungeons': All Medallions and Spiritual Stones.
'100 Gold Skulltula Tokens': All 100 Gold Skulltula Tokens.

trials_random.tooltip:
Sets a random number of trials to
enter Ganon's Tower.

trials.tooltip:
Trials are randomly selected. If hints are
enabled, then there will be hints for which
trials need to be completed.

logic_rules.tooltip:
Sets the rules the logic uses
to determine accessibility.

'Glitchless': No glitches are
required, but may require some
minor tricks

'Glitched': Movement oriented
glitches are likely required.
No locations excluded.

'No Logic': All locations are
considered available. May not
be beatable.

all_reachable.tooltip:
When this option is enabled, the randomizer will
guarantee that every item is obtainable and every
location is reachable.

When disabled, only required items and locations
to beat the game will be guaranteed reachable.

Even when enabled, some locations may still be able
to hold the keys needed to reach them.

bombchus_in_logic.tooltip:
Bombchus are properly considered in logic.

The first Bombchu pack will always be 20.
Subsequent packs will be 5 or 10 based on
how many you have.

Bombchus can be purchased for 60/99/180
rupees once they have been found.

Bombchu Bowling opens with Bombchus.
Bombchus are available at Kokiri Shop
and the Bazaar. Bombchu refills cannot
be bought until Bombchus have been
obtained.

one_item_per_dungeon.tooltip:
Dungeons have exactly one major
item. This naturally makes each
dungeon similar in value instead
of valued based on chest count.

Spirit Temple Colossus hands count
as part of the dungeon. Spirit
Temple has TWO items to match
vanilla distribution.

Dungeon items and GS Tokens do
not count as major items.

mq_dungeons_random.tooltip:
If set, a random number of dungeons
will have Master Quest designs.

mq_dungeons.tooltip:
Select a number of Master Quest
dungeons to appear in the game.

0: All dungeon will have their
original designs. (default)

6: Half of all dungeons will
be from Master Quest.

12: All dungeons will have
Master Quest redesigns.

shuffle_kokiri_sword.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Kokiri Sword into the pool.

This will require extensive use of sticks until the
sword is found.

shuffle_ocarinas.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Fairy Ocarina and the Ocarina
of Time into the pool.

This will require finding an Ocarina before being able
to play songs.

shuffle_weird_egg.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Weird Egg from Malon into the pool.

This will require finding the Weird Egg to talk to Zelda in
Hyrule Castle, which in turn locks rewards from Impa, Saria,
Malon, and Talon, as well as the Happy Mask sidequest.
If Open Kakariko Gate is disabled, the Weird Egg will also
be required for Zelda's Letter to open the gate as child.

shuffle_gerudo_card.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Gerudo Card into the item pool.

The Gerudo Card is required to enter the Gerudo Training Grounds,
however it does not prevent the guards throwing you in jail.

shuffle_song_items.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the songs into the rest of the
item pool.

This means that song locations can contain other items,
and any location can contain a song. Otherwise, songs
are only shuffled among themselves.

shuffle_cows.tooltip:
Enabling this causes playing Epona's song infront
of cows to give an item. There are 9 cows, and an
extra in MQ Jabu

shuffle_beans.tooltip:
Enabling this adds a pack of 10 beans to the item pool
and changes the Magic Bean Salesman to sell a random
item once at the price of 60 Rupees.

entrance_shuffle.tooltip:
Shuffle entrances bidirectionally within different pools.

'Dungeons Only':
Shuffle dungeon entrances with each other, including Bottom
of the Well, Ice Cavern, and Gerudo Training Grounds.
However, Ganon's Castle is not shuffled.
Additionally, the entrances of Deku Tree, Fire Temple and
Bottom of the Well are opened for both adult and child.

'Simple Indoors':
Shuffle dungeon entrances along with simple Grotto and
Interior entrances (i.e. most Houses and Great Fairies).

'All Indoors':
Extended version of 'Simple Indoors' with some extra entrances:
Windmill, Link's House, Temple of Time and Dampe's Grave.

'All Indoors & Overworld':
Same as 'All Indoors' but with Overworld loading zones shuffled
in a new separate pool. Owl drop positions are also randomized.

shuffle_scrubs.tooltip:
'Off': Only the 3 Scrubs that give one-time
items in the vanilla game (PoH, Deku Nut
capacity, and Deku Stick capacity) will
have random items.

'Affordable': All Scrub prices will be
reduced to 10 rupees each.

'Expensive': All Scrub prices will be
their vanilla prices. This will require
spending over 1000 rupees on Scrubs.

'Random Prices': All Scrub prices will be
between 0-99 rupees. This will on average
be very, very expensive overall.

shopsanity.tooltip:
Shop contents are randomized.
(X Items): Shops have X random non-shop (Special
Deal!) items. They will always be on the left
side, and some of the lower value shop items
will be replaced to make room for these.

(Random): Each shop will have a random number
of non-shop items up to a maximum of 4.

The non-shop items have no requirements except
money, while the normal shop items (such as
200/300 rupee tunics) have normal vanilla
requirements. This means that, for example,
as a child you cannot buy 200/300 rupee
tunics, but you can buy non-shop tunics.

Non-shop Bombchus will unlock the chu slot
in your inventory, which, if Bombchus are in
logic, is needed to buy Bombchu refills.
Otherwise, the Bomb Bag is required.

tokensanity.tooltip:
Token reward from Gold Skulltulas are
shuffled into the pool.

'Dungeons Only': This only shuffles
the GS locations that are within
dungeons, increasing the value of
most dungeons and making internal
dungeon exploration more diverse.

'All Tokens': Effectively adds 100
new locations for items to appear.

shuffle_mapcompass.tooltip:
'Remove': Maps and Compasses are removed.
This will add a small amount of money and
refill items to the pool.

'Start With': Maps and Compasses are given to
you from the start. This will add a small
amount of money and refill items to the pool.

'Vanilla': Maps and Compasses will appear in
their vanilla locations.

'Dungeon': Maps and Compasses can only appear
in their respective dungeon.

'Anywhere': Maps and Compasses can appear
anywhere in the world.

Setting 'Remove', 'Start With, or 'Anywhere' will
add 2 more possible locations to each Dungeons.
This makes dungeons more profitable, especially
Ice Cavern, Water Temple, and Jabu Jabu's Belly.

shuffle_smallkeys.tooltip:
'Remove': Small Keys are removed. All locked
doors in dungeons will be unlocked. An easier
mode.

'Vanilla': Small Keys will appear in their
vanilla locations. You start with 3 keys in
Spirit Temple MQ because the vanilla key
layout is not beatable in logic.

'Dungeon': Small Keys can only appear in their
respective dungeon. If Fire Temple is not a
Master Quest dungeon, the door to the Boss Key
chest will be unlocked

'Anywhere': Small Keys can appear
anywhere in the world. A difficult mode since
it is more likely to need to enter a dungeon
multiple times.

Try different combination out, such as:
'Small Keys: Dungeon' + 'Boss Keys: Anywhere'
for a milder Keysanity experience.

shuffle_bosskeys.tooltip:
'Remove': Boss Keys are removed. All locked
doors in dungeons will be unlocked. An easier
mode.

'Vanilla': Boss Keys will appear in their
vanilla locations.

'Dungeon': Boss Keys can only appear in their
respective dungeon.

'Anywhere': Boss Keys can appear
anywhere in the world. A difficult mode since
it is more likely to need to enter a dungeon
multiple times.

Try different combination out, such as:
'Small Keys: Dungeon' + 'Boss Keys: Anywhere'
for a milder Keysanity experience.

enhance_map_compass.tooltip:
Gives the Map and Compass extra functionality.
Map will tell if a dungeon is vanilla or Master Quest.
Compass will tell what medallion or stone is within.
The Temple of Time Altar will no longer provide any
information.

'Maps/Compasses: Remove': The dungeon information is
not available anywhere in the game.

'Maps/Compasses: Start With': The dungeon information
is available immediately from the dungeon menu.

unlocked_ganondorf.tooltip:
The Boss Key door in Ganon's Tower
will start unlocked. This is intended
to be used with reduced trial
requirements to make it more likely
that skipped trials can be avoided.

disabled_locations.tooltip:
Prevent locations from being required. Major
items can still appear there, however they
will never be required to beat the game.

Most dungeon locations have a MQ alternative.
If the location does not exist because of MQ
then it will be ignored. So make sure to
disable both versions if that is the intent.

logic_child_rolling_with_strength.text: Rolling Goron (Hot Rodder Goron) as Child with Strength
logic_child_rolling_with_strength.tooltip:
Use the bombflower on the stairs or near Medigoron.
Timing is tight, especially without backwalking

logic_fewer_tunic_requirements.tooltip:
Allows the following possible without Tunics:
- Enter Water Temple. The key below the center
pillar still requires Zora Tunic.
- Enter Fire Temple. Only the first floor is
accessible, and not Volvagia.
- Zora's Fountain Bottom Freestanding PoH.
Might not have enough health to resurface.
- Gerudo Training Grounds Underwater
Silver Rupee Chest. May need to make multiple
trips.

logic_man_on_roof.tooltip:
Can be reached by side-hopping off
the watchtower.

logic_dc_staircase.tooltip:
The Bow can be used to knock down the stairs
with two well-timed shots.

logic_dc_jump.text: Dodongo's Cavern Spike Trap Room Jump without Hover Boots

logic_gerudo_kitchen.text: Gerudo Fortress "Kitchen" with No Additional Items
logic_gerudo_kitchen.tooltip:
The logic normally guarantees one of Bow, Hookshot,
or Hover Boots.

logic_deku_basement_gs.text: Deku Tree Basement Vines GS with Jump Slash
logic_deku_basement_gs.tooltip: Can be defeated by doing a precise jump slash.

logic_rusted_switches.tooltip:
Applies to:
- Fire Temple Highest Goron Chest.
- MQ Fire Temple Lizalfos Maze.
- MQ Spirit Trial.

logic_botw_basement.text: Bottom of the Well Basement Chest with Strength & Sticks
logic_botw_basement.tooltip:
The chest in the basement can be reached with
strength by doing a jump slash with a lit
stick to access the bomb flowers.

logic_forest_mq_block_puzzle.text: Skip Forest Temple MQ Block Puzzle with Bombchu
logic_forest_mq_block_puzzle.tooltip:
Send the Bombchu straight up the center of the
wall directly to the left upon entering the room.

logic_spirit_child_bombchu.text: Spirit Temple Child Side Bridge with Bombchu
logic_spirit_child_bombchu.tooltip: A carefully-timed Bombchu can hit the switch.

logic_windmill_poh.text: Windmill PoH as Adult with Nothing
logic_windmill_poh.tooltip:
Can jump up to the spinning platform from
below as adult.

logic_crater_bean_poh_with_hovers.text: Crater's Bean PoH with Hover Boots
logic_crater_bean_poh_with_hovers.tooltip:
Hover from the base of the bridge
near Goron City and walk up the
very steep slope.

logic_zora_with_cucco.tooltip:
Can fly behind the waterfall with
a cucco as child.

logic_gtg_mq_with_hookshot.text: Gerudo Training Grounds MQ Left Side Silver Rupees with Hookshot
logic_gtg_mq_with_hookshot.tooltip:
The highest silver rupee can be obtained by
hookshotting the target and then immediately jump
slashing toward the rupee.

logic_forest_vines.text: Forest Temple East Courtyard Vines with Hookshot
logic_forest_vines.tooltip:
The vines in Forest Temple leading to where the well
drain switch is in the standard form can be barely
reached with just the Hookshot.

logic_forest_well_swim.text: Swim Through Forest Temple MQ Well with Hookshot
logic_forest_well_swim.tooltip:
Shoot the vines in the well as low and as far to
the right as possible, and then immediately swim
under the ceiling to the right. This can only be
required if Forest Temple is in its Master Quest
form.

logic_dmt_bombable.text: Death Mountain Trail Bombable Chest with Strength
logic_dmt_bombable.tooltip:
Child Link can blow up the wall using a nearby bomb
flower. You must backwalk with the flower and then
quickly throw it toward the wall.

logic_water_bk_chest.text: Water Temple Boss Key Chest with Iron Boots
logic_water_bk_chest.tooltip:
Stand on the blue switch in the Stinger room with the
Iron Boots, wait for the water to rise all the way up,
and then swim straight to the exit. You should grab the
ledge as you surface. It works best if you don't mash B.

logic_adult_kokiri_gs.text: Adult Kokiri Forest GS with Hover Boots
logic_adult_kokiri_gs.tooltip:
Can be obtained without Hookshot by using the Hover
Boots off of one of the roots.

logic_spirit_mq_frozen_eye.text: Spirit Temple MQ Frozen Eye Switch without Fire
logic_spirit_mq_frozen_eye.tooltip:
You can melt the ice by shooting an arrow through a
torch. The only way to find a line of sight for this
shot is to first spawn a Song of Time block, and then
stand on the very edge of it.

logic_spirit_wall.text: Spirit Temple Shifting Wall with No Additional Items
logic_spirit_wall.tooltip:
The logic normally guarantees a way of dealing with both
the Beamos and the Walltula before climbing the wall.

logic_spirit_lobby_gs.text: Spirit Temple Main Room GS with Boomerang
logic_spirit_lobby_gs.tooltip:
Standing on the highest part of the arm of the statue, a
precise Boomerang throw can kill and obtain this Gold
Skulltula. You must throw the Boomerang slightly off to
the side so that it curves into the Skulltula, as aiming
directly at it will clank off of the wall in front.

logic_spirit_mq_sun_block_gs.text: Spirit Temple MQ Sun Block Room GS with Boomerang
logic_spirit_mq_sun_block_gs.tooltip:
Throw the Boomerang in such a way that it
curves through the side of the glass block
to hit the Gold Skulltula.

logic_jabu_mq_sot_gs.text: Jabu MQ Song of Time Block GS with Boomerang
logic_jabu_mq_sot_gs.tooltip:
Allow the Boomerang to return to you through
the Song of Time block to grab the token.

logic_botw_mq_dead_hand_key.text: Bottom of the Well MQ Dead Hand Freestanding Key with Boomerang
logic_botw_mq_dead_hand_key.tooltip:
Boomerang can fish the item out of the rubble without
needing explosives to blow it up.

logic_fire_flame_maze.text: Fire Temple Flame Wall Maze Skip
logic_fire_flame_maze.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of
a flame wall before it can rise up to block you.
To do it without taking damage is more precise.
Allows you to progress without needing either a
Small Key or Hover Boots.

logic_fire_mq_flame_maze.text: Fire Temple MQ Flame Wall Maze Skip
logic_fire_mq_flame_maze.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of
a flame wall before it can rise up to block you.
To do it without taking damage is more precise.
Allows you to reach a GS without needing either
Song of Time or Hover Boots.

logic_fire_mq_near_boss.text: Fire Temple MQ Chest Near Boss without Breaking Crate
logic_fire_mq_near_boss.tooltip:
The hitbox for the torch extends a bit outside of the crate.
Shoot a flaming arrow at the side of the crate to light the
torch without needing to get over there and break the crate.

logic_fire_mq_maze_side_room.text: Fire Temple MQ Boulder Maze Side Room without Box
logic_fire_mq_maze_side_room.tooltip:
You can walk from the blue switch to the door and
quickly open the door before the bars reclose. This
skips needing the Hookshot in order to reach a box
to place on the switch.

logic_fire_mq_bk_chest.text: Fire Temple MQ Boss Key Chest without Bow
logic_fire_mq_bk_chest.tooltip:
Din's alone can be used to unbar the door to
the boss key chest's room thanks to an
oversight in the way the game counts how many
torches have been lit.

logic_zora_river_lower.text: Zora's River Lower Freestanding PoH as Adult with Nothing
logic_zora_river_lower.tooltip:
Adult can reach this PoH with a precise jump,
no Hover Boots required.

logic_water_cracked_wall_hovers.text: Water Temple Cracked Wall with Hover Boots
logic_water_cracked_wall_hovers.tooltip:
With a midair side-hop while wearing the Hover
Boots, you can reach the cracked wall without
needing to raise the water up to the middle level.

logic_shadow_freestanding_key.text: Shadow Temple Freestanding Key with Bombchu
logic_shadow_freestanding_key.tooltip:
Release the Bombchu with good timing so that
it explodes near the bottom of the pot.

logic_adult_meadow_access.text: Adult Meadow Access without Saria's or Minuet
logic_adult_meadow_access.tooltip:
With a specific position and angle, you can
backflip over Mido.

logic_volvagia_jump.text: Reach Volvagia without Hover Boots or Pillar
logic_volvagia_jump.tooltip:
The Fire Temple Boss Door can be reached with a precise
jump. You must be touching the side wall of the room so
so that Link will grab the ledge from farther away than
is normally possible.

logic_lab_diving.text: Diving in the Lab without Gold Scale
logic_lab_diving.tooltip:
Remove the Iron Boots in the midst of
Hookshotting the underwater crate.

logic_biggoron_bolero.text: Deliver Eye Drops with Bolero of Fire
logic_biggoron_bolero.tooltip:
If you do not wear the Goron Tunic, the heat timer
inside the crater will override the trade item's timer.
When you exit to Death Mountain Trail you will have
one second to deliver the Eye Drops before the timer
expires. It works best if you play Bolero as quickly as
possible upon receiving the Eye Drops. If you have few
hearts, there is enough time to dip Goron City to
refresh the heat timer as long as you've already
pulled the block.

logic_wasteland_crossing.text: Wasteland Crossing without Hover Boots or Longshot
logic_wasteland_crossing.tooltip:
You can beat the quicksand by backwalking across it
in a specific way.

logic_colossus_gs.text: Desert Colossus Hill GS with Hookshot
logic_colossus_gs.tooltip:
Somewhat precise. If you kill enough Leevers
you can get enough of a break to take some time
to aim more carefully.

logic_dc_scarecrow_gs.text: Dodongo's Cavern Scarecrow GS with Armos Statue
logic_dc_scarecrow_gs.tooltip:
You can jump off an Armos Statue to reach the
alcove with the Gold Skulltula. It takes quite
a long time to pull the statue the entire way.
The jump to the alcove can be a pit picky when
done as child.

logic_kakariko_tower_gs.text: Kakariko Tower GS with Jump Slash
logic_kakariko_tower_gs.tooltip:
Climb the tower as high as you can without
touching the Gold Skulltula, then let go and
jump slash immediately. You will take fall
damage.

logic_lab_wall_gs.text: Lake Hylia Lab Wall GS with Jump Slash
logic_lab_wall_gs.tooltip:
The jump slash to actually collect the
token is somewhat precise.

logic_spirit_mq_lower_adult.text: Spirit Temple MQ Lower Adult without Fire Arrows
logic_spirit_mq_lower_adult.tooltip:
It can be done with Din's Fire and Bow.
Whenever an arrow passes through a lit torch, it
resets the timer. It's finicky but it's also
possible to stand on the pillar next to the center
torch, which makes it easier.

logic_spirit_map_chest.text: Spirit Temple Map Chest with Bow
logic_spirit_map_chest.tooltip:
To get a line of sight from the upper torch to
the map chest torches, you must pull an Armos
statue all the way up the stairs.

logic_spirit_sun_chest.text: Spirit Temple Sun Block Room Chest with Bow
logic_spirit_sun_chest.tooltip:
Using the blocks in the room as platforms you can
get lines of sight to all three torches. The timer
on the torches is quite short so you must move
quickly in order to light all three.

logic_forest_outdoors_ledge.text: Forest Temple NE Outdoors Ledge with Hover Boots
logic_forest_outdoors_ledge.tooltip:
With precise Hover Boots movement you can fall down
to this ledge from upper balconies. If done precisely
enough, it is not necessary to take fall damage.
In MQ, this skips a Longshot requirement.
In Vanilla, this can skip a Hookshot requirement in
entrance randomizer.

logic_water_boss_key_region.text: Water Temple Boss Key Region with Hover Boots
logic_water_boss_key_region.tooltip:
With precise Hover Boots movement it is possible
to reach the boss key chest's region without
needing the Longshot. It is not necessary to take
damage from the spikes. The Gold Skulltula Token
in the following room can also be obtained with
just the Hover Boots.

logic_water_falling_platform_gs.text: Water Temple Falling Platform Room GS with Hookshot
logic_water_falling_platform_gs.tooltip:
If you stand on the very edge of the platform, this
Gold Skulltula can be obtained with only the Hookshot.

logic_crater_upper_to_lower.text: Death Mountain Crater Upper to Lower with Hammer
logic_crater_upper_to_lower.tooltip:
With the Hammer, you can jumpslash the rock twice
in the same jump in order to destroy it before you
fall into the lava.

logic_zora_with_hovers.text: Zora's Domain Entry with Hover Boots
logic_zora_with_hovers.tooltip: Can hover behind the waterfall as adult.

logic_shadow_statue.text: Shadow Temple River Statue with Bombchu
logic_shadow_statue.tooltip:
By sending a Bombchu around the edge of the
gorge, you can knock down the statue without
needing a Bow.
Applies in both vanilla and MQ Shadow.

logic_link_goron_dins.text: Stop Link the Goron with Din's Fire

logic_fire_song_of_time.text: Fire Temple Song of Time Room GS without Song of Time
logic_fire_song_of_time.tooltip: A precise jump can be used to reach this room.

logic_fire_strength.tooltip:
A precise jump can be used to skip
pushing the block.

logic_fire_mq_bombable_chest.text: Fire Temple MQ Big Lava Room Bombable Chest without Hookshot
logic_fire_mq_bombable_chest.tooltip:
A precisely-angled jump can get over the wall
of fire in this room. It's expected that you
will take damage as you do this. As it may
take multiple attempts, you won't be expected
to use a fairy to survive.

logic_light_trial_mq.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of
a flame wall before it can rise up to block you.
In this case it doesn't seem possible to do it
without taking damage.

logic_ice_mq_scarecrow.text: Ice Cavern MQ Scarecrow GS with No Additional Items
logic_ice_mq_scarecrow.tooltip: A precise jump can be used to reach this alcove.

logic_earliest_adult_trade.tooltip: Select the earliest item that can appear in the adult trade sequence.

logic_latest_adult_trade.tooltip: Select the latest item that can appear in the adult trade sequence.

logic_lens.tooltip:
'Required everywhere': every invisible or
fake object will expect you to have the
Lens of Truth and Magic. The exception is
passing through the first wall in Bottom of
the Well, since that is required in vanilla.

'Wasteland': The lens is needed to follow
the ghost guide across the Haunted Wasteland.

no_escape_sequence.tooltip:
The tower escape sequence between
Ganondorf and Ganon will be skipped.

no_guard_stealth.tooltip:
The crawlspace into Hyrule Castle goes
straight to Zelda, skipping the guards.

no_epona_race.tooltip:
Epona can be summoned with Epona's Song
without needing to race Ingo.

useful_cutscenes.tooltip:
The cutscenes of the Poes in Forest Temple,
Darunia in Fire Temple, and the introduction
to Twinrova will not be skipped.

fast_chests.tooltip:
All chest animations are fast. If disabled,
the animation time is slow for major items.

logic_no_night_tokens_without_suns_song.tooltip:
GS Tokens that can only be obtained
during the night expect you to have Sun's
Song to collect them. This prevents needing
to wait until night for some locations.

free_scarecrow.tooltip:
Pulling out the Ocarina near a
spot at which Pierre can spawn will
do so, without needing the song.

start_with_fast_travel.tooltip:
Start the game with Prelude of Light,
Serenade of Water, and Farore's Wind.

Two song locations will give items,
instead of Prelude and Serenade.

start_with_rupees.tooltip: Start the game with 99 rupees. Wallet upgrades fill wallet.

start_with_wallet.tooltip: Start the game with the largest wallet (999 max).

start_with_deku_equipment.tooltip:
Start the game with 10 Deku sticks and 20 Deku nuts.
Additionally, start the game with a Deku shield equipped,
unless playing with the Shopsanity setting.

fast_chickens.tooltip: Moves all except the Chicken near the pen into the pen.

big_poe_count_random.tooltip:
The Poe buyer will give a reward for turning
in a random number of Big Poes.

big_poe_count.tooltip:
The Poe buyer will give a reward for turning
in the chosen number of Big Poes.

ocarina_songs.tooltip:
Will need to memorize a new set of songs.
Can be silly, but difficult. Songs are
generally sensible, and warp songs are
typically more difficult.

correct_chest_sizes.tooltip:
Chests will be large if they contain a major
item and small if they don't. Boss keys will
be in gold chests. This allows skipping
chests if they are small. However, skipping
small chests will mean having low health,
ammo, and rupees, so doing so is a risk.

clearer_hints.tooltip:
The hints provided by Gossip Stones will
be very direct if this option is enabled.

hints.tooltip:
Gossip Stones can be made to give hints
about where items can be found.

Different settings can be chosen to
decide which item is needed to
speak to Gossip Stones. Choosing to
stick with the Mask of Truth will
make the hints very difficult to
obtain.

Hints for 'on the way of the hero' are
locations that contain items that are
required to beat the game.

hint_dist.tooltip:
Useless has nothing but junk hints.
Strong distribution has a good
spread of different hint types.
Multiworld distribution has only
a few specific, useful hint types.
Tournament distribution has a set
number of hints for each type.

text_shuffle.tooltip:
Will make things confusing for comedic value.

'Shuffled except Hints and Keys': Key texts
are not shuffled because in keysanity it is
inconvenient to figure out which keys are which
without the correct text. Similarly, non-shop
items sold in shops will also retain standard
text for the purpose of accurate price checks.

junk_ice_traps.tooltip:
Off: All Ice Traps are removed.
Normal: Only Ice Traps from the base item pool
are placed.
Extra Ice Traps: Chance to add extra Ice Traps
when junk items are added to the itempool.
Ice Trap Mayhem: All added junk items will
be Ice Traps.
Ice Trap Onslaught: All junk items will be
replaced by Ice Traps, even those in the
base pool.

item_pool_value.tooltip:
Changes the amount of bonus items that
are available in the game.

'Plentiful': Extra major items are added.

'Balanced': Original item pool.

'Scarce': Some excess items are removed,
including health upgrades.

'Minimal': Most excess items are removed.

damage_multiplier.tooltip:
Changes the amount of damage taken.

'OHKO': Link dies in one hit.

starting_tod.tooltip:
Change up Link's sleep routine.

Daytime officially starts at 6:30,
nighttime at 18:00 (6:00 PM).

Default is 10:00 in the morning.
The alternatives are multiples of 3 hours.

starting_age.tooltip:
Choose which age Link will start as.

Starting as adult means you start with
the master sword in your inventory.

Only the child option is compatible with
Closed Forest.

display_dpad.tooltip:
Shows an additional HUD element displaying
current available options on the D-Pad.

kokiri_color.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

goron_color.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

zora_color.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

sword_trail_duration.tooltip: Select the duration for sword trails.

sword_trail_color_inner.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.
'Rainbow': Rainbow sword trails.

sword_trail_color_outer.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.
'Rainbow': Rainbow sword trails.

heart_color.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

magic_color.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

navi_color_default.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

navi_color_enemy.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

navi_color_npc.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

navi_color_prop.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.

silver_gauntlets_color.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.
'Rainbow': Rainbow sword trails.

golden_gauntlets_color.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
color from this list of colors.
'Completely Random': Choose a random
color from any color the N64 can draw.
'Rainbow': Rainbow sword trails.

background_music.tooltip:
'No Music': No background music.
is played.

'Random': Area background music is
randomized. Additional music can
be loaded from data/Music/

sfx_low_hp.tooltip:
'Random Choice': Choose a random
sound from this list.
'Default': Beep. Beep. Beep.

sfx_ocarina.tooltip: Change the sound of the ocarina.

settings.tooltip: Enabling this will change the seed.
settings.name: create_spoiler

settings.tooltip:
The first time compressed generation will take a while,
but subsequent generations will be quick. It is highly
recommended to compress or the game will crash
frequently except on real N64 hardware.

Patch files are used to send the patched data to other
people without sending the ROM file.
settings.name: compress_rom

sections.name: multiworld_section
sections.subheader:
This is used for co_op generations. Increasing Player Count will drastically increase the generation time.
For more information, see:
https://github.com/TestRunnerSRL/bizhawk_co_op

sections.name: preset_section

settings.tooltip: Select a setting preset to apply.
settings.name: presets

sections.subheader:
Presets are settings that can be saved and loaded from.
Loading a preset will overwrite all settings that affect the seed.

settings.tooltip: Randomizes most Main Rules.
settings.name: randomize_settings

settings.tooltip:
Open Forest: Mido no longer blocks the path to the
Deku Tree, and the Kokiri boy no longer blocks the path
out of the forest.

Closed Deku: The Kokiri boy no longer blocks the path
out of the forest, but Mido still blocks the path to the
Deku Tree, requiring Kokiri Sword and Deku Shield to access
the Deku Tree.

Closed Forest: The Kokiri Sword and Slingshot are always
available somewhere in the forest. This is incompatible with
Start as Adult and shuffling "All Indoors" and/or "Overworld"
entrances will force this to Closed Deku if selected.
settings.name: open_forest

settings.tooltip:
The Door of Time starts opened instead of needing to
play the Song of Time. If this is not set, only
an Ocarina and Song of Time must be found to open
the Door of Time.
settings.name: open_door_of_time

settings.tooltip:
King Zora starts out as moved. This also removes
Ruto's Letter from the item pool.
settings.name: open_fountain

settings.tooltip:
'Rescue One Carpenter': Only the bottom left
carpenter must be rescued.

'Open Gerudo Fortress': The carpenters are rescued from
the start of the game, and if 'Shuffle Gerudo Card' is disabled,
the player starts with the Gerudo Card in the inventory
allowing access to Gerudo Training Grounds.
settings.name: gerudo_fortress

settings.tooltip:
'Always Open': Rainbow Bridge is always present.
'Vanilla Requirements': Spirit/Shadow Medallions and Light Arrows.
'All Spiritual Stones': All 3 Spiritual Stones.
'All Medallions': All 6 Medallions.
'All Dungeons': All Medallions and Spiritual Stones.
'100 Gold Skulltula Tokens': All 100 Gold Skulltula Tokens.
settings.name: bridge

settings.tooltip:
Sets a random number of trials to
enter Ganon's Tower.
settings.name: trials_random

settings.tooltip:
Trials are randomly selected. If hints are
enabled, then there will be hints for which
trials need to be completed.
settings.name: trials

settings.tooltip:
Sets the rules the logic uses
to determine accessibility.

'Glitchless': No glitches are
required, but may require some
minor tricks

'Glitched': Movement oriented
glitches are likely required.
No locations excluded.

'No Logic': All locations are
considered available. May not
be beatable.
settings.name: logic_rules

settings.tooltip:
When this option is enabled, the randomizer will
guarantee that every item is obtainable and every
location is reachable.

When disabled, only required items and locations
to beat the game will be guaranteed reachable.

Even when enabled, some locations may still be able
to hold the keys needed to reach them.
settings.name: all_reachable

settings.tooltip:
Bombchus are properly considered in logic.

The first Bombchu pack will always be 20.
Subsequent packs will be 5 or 10 based on
how many you have.

Bombchus can be purchased for 60/99/180
rupees once they have been found.

Bombchu Bowling opens with Bombchus.
Bombchus are available at Kokiri Shop
and the Bazaar. Bombchu refills cannot
be bought until Bombchus have been
obtained.
settings.name: bombchus_in_logic

settings.tooltip:
Dungeons have exactly one major
item. This naturally makes each
dungeon similar in value instead
of valued based on chest count.

Spirit Temple Colossus hands count
as part of the dungeon. Spirit
Temple has TWO items to match
vanilla distribution.

Dungeon items and GS Tokens do
not count as major items.
settings.name: one_item_per_dungeon

settings.tooltip:
If set, a random number of dungeons
will have Master Quest designs.
settings.name: mq_dungeons_random

settings.tooltip:
Select a number of Master Quest
dungeons to appear in the game.

0: All dungeon will have their
original designs. (default)

6: Half of all dungeons will
be from Master Quest.

12: All dungeons will have
Master Quest redesigns.
settings.name: mq_dungeons

settings.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Kokiri Sword into the pool.

This will require extensive use of sticks until the
sword is found.
settings.name: shuffle_kokiri_sword

settings.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Fairy Ocarina and the Ocarina
of Time into the pool.

This will require finding an Ocarina before being able
to play songs.
settings.name: shuffle_ocarinas

settings.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Weird Egg from Malon into the pool.

This will require finding the Weird Egg to talk to Zelda in
Hyrule Castle, which in turn locks rewards from Impa, Saria,
Malon, and Talon, as well as the Happy Mask sidequest.
If Open Kakariko Gate is disabled, the Weird Egg will also
be required for Zelda's Letter to open the gate as child.
settings.name: shuffle_weird_egg

settings.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the Gerudo Card into the item pool.

The Gerudo Card is required to enter the Gerudo Training Grounds,
however it does not prevent the guards throwing you in jail.
settings.name: shuffle_gerudo_card

settings.tooltip:
Enabling this shuffles the songs into the rest of the
item pool.

This means that song locations can contain other items,
and any location can contain a song. Otherwise, songs
are only shuffled among themselves.
settings.name: shuffle_song_items

settings.tooltip:
Enabling this causes playing Epona's song infront
of cows to give an item. There are 9 cows, and an
extra in MQ Jabu
settings.name: shuffle_cows

settings.tooltip:
Enabling this adds a pack of 10 beans to the item pool
and changes the Magic Bean Salesman to sell a random
item once at the price of 60 Rupees.
settings.name: shuffle_beans

settings.tooltip:
Shuffle entrances bidirectionally within different pools.

'Dungeons Only':
Shuffle dungeon entrances with each other, including Bottom
of the Well, Ice Cavern, and Gerudo Training Grounds.
However, Ganon's Castle is not shuffled.
Additionally, the entrances of Deku Tree, Fire Temple and
Bottom of the Well are opened for both adult and child.

'Simple Indoors':
Shuffle dungeon entrances along with simple Grotto and
Interior entrances (i.e. most Houses and Great Fairies).

'All Indoors':
Extended version of 'Simple Indoors' with some extra entrances:
Windmill, Link's House, Temple of Time and Dampe's Grave.

'All Indoors & Overworld':
Same as 'All Indoors' but with Overworld loading zones shuffled
in a new separate pool. Owl drop positions are also randomized.
settings.name: entrance_shuffle

settings.tooltip:
'Off': Only the 3 Scrubs that give one-time
items in the vanilla game (PoH, Deku Nut
capacity, and Deku Stick capacity) will
have random items.

'Affordable': All Scrub prices will be
reduced to 10 rupees each.

'Expensive': All Scrub prices will be
their vanilla prices. This will require
spending over 1000 rupees on Scrubs.

'Random Prices': All Scrub prices will be
between 0-99 rupees. This will on average
be very, very expensive overall.
settings.name: shuffle_scrubs

settings.tooltip:
Shop contents are randomized.
(X Items): Shops have X random non-shop (Special
Deal!) items. They will always be on the left
side, and some of the lower value shop items
will be replaced to make room for these.

(Random): Each shop will have a random number
of non-shop items up to a maximum of 4.

The non-shop items have no requirements except
money, while the normal shop items (such as
200/300 rupee tunics) have normal vanilla
requirements. This means that, for example,
as a child you cannot buy 200/300 rupee
tunics, but you can buy non-shop tunics.

Non-shop Bombchus will unlock the chu slot
in your inventory, which, if Bombchus are in
logic, is needed to buy Bombchu refills.
Otherwise, the Bomb Bag is required.
settings.name: shopsanity

settings.tooltip:
Token reward from Gold Skulltulas are
shuffled into the pool.

'Dungeons Only': This only shuffles
the GS locations that are within
dungeons, increasing the value of
most dungeons and making internal
dungeon exploration more diverse.

'All Tokens': Effectively adds 100
new locations for items to appear.
settings.name: tokensanity

settings.tooltip:
'Remove': Maps and Compasses are removed.
This will add a small amount of money and
refill items to the pool.

'Start With': Maps and Compasses are given to
you from the start. This will add a small
amount of money and refill items to the pool.

'Vanilla': Maps and Compasses will appear in
their vanilla locations.

'Dungeon': Maps and Compasses can only appear
in their respective dungeon.

'Anywhere': Maps and Compasses can appear
anywhere in the world.

Setting 'Remove', 'Start With, or 'Anywhere' will
add 2 more possible locations to each Dungeons.
This makes dungeons more profitable, especially
Ice Cavern, Water Temple, and Jabu Jabu's Belly.
settings.name: shuffle_mapcompass

settings.tooltip:
'Remove': Small Keys are removed. All locked
doors in dungeons will be unlocked. An easier
mode.

'Vanilla': Small Keys will appear in their
vanilla locations. You start with 3 keys in
Spirit Temple MQ because the vanilla key
layout is not beatable in logic.

'Dungeon': Small Keys can only appear in their
respective dungeon. If Fire Temple is not a
Master Quest dungeon, the door to the Boss Key
chest will be unlocked

'Anywhere': Small Keys can appear
anywhere in the world. A difficult mode since
it is more likely to need to enter a dungeon
multiple times.

Try different combination out, such as:
'Small Keys: Dungeon' + 'Boss Keys: Anywhere'
for a milder Keysanity experience.
settings.name: shuffle_smallkeys

settings.tooltip:
'Remove': Boss Keys are removed. All locked
doors in dungeons will be unlocked. An easier
mode.

'Vanilla': Boss Keys will appear in their
vanilla locations.

'Dungeon': Boss Keys can only appear in their
respective dungeon.

'Anywhere': Boss Keys can appear
anywhere in the world. A difficult mode since
it is more likely to need to enter a dungeon
multiple times.

Try different combination out, such as:
'Small Keys: Dungeon' + 'Boss Keys: Anywhere'
for a milder Keysanity experience.
settings.name: shuffle_bosskeys

settings.tooltip:
Gives the Map and Compass extra functionality.
Map will tell if a dungeon is vanilla or Master Quest.
Compass will tell what medallion or stone is within.
The Temple of Time Altar will no longer provide any
information.

'Maps/Compasses: Remove': The dungeon information is
not available anywhere in the game.

'Maps/Compasses: Start With': The dungeon information
is available immediately from the dungeon menu.
settings.name: enhance_map_compass

settings.tooltip:
The Boss Key door in Ganon's Tower
will start unlocked. This is intended
to be used with reduced trial
requirements to make it more likely
that skipped trials can be avoided.
settings.name: unlocked_ganondorf

settings.tooltip:
Prevent locations from being required. Major
items can still appear there, however they
will never be required to beat the game.

Most dungeon locations have a MQ alternative.
If the location does not exist because of MQ
then it will be ignored. So make sure to
disable both versions if that is the intent.
settings.name: disabled_locations

options.name: logic_child_rolling_with_strength
options.text: Rolling Goron (Hot Rodder Goron) as Child with Strength
options.tooltip:
Use the bombflower on the stairs or near Medigoron.
Timing is tight, especially without backwalking

options.name: logic_fewer_tunic_requirements
options.tooltip:
Allows the following possible without Tunics:
- Enter Water Temple. The key below the center
pillar still requires Zora Tunic.
- Enter Fire Temple. Only the first floor is
accessible, and not Volvagia.
- Zora's Fountain Bottom Freestanding PoH.
Might not have enough health to resurface.
- Gerudo Training Grounds Underwater
Silver Rupee Chest. May need to make multiple
trips.

options.name: logic_child_deadhand
options.tooltip: Requires 9 sticks or 5 jump slashes.

options.name: logic_man_on_roof
options.tooltip:
Can be reached by side-hopping off
the watchtower.

options.name: logic_dc_staircase
options.tooltip:
The Bow can be used to knock down the stairs
with two well-timed shots.

options.name: logic_dc_jump
options.text: Dodongo's Cavern Spike Trap Room Jump without Hover Boots
options.tooltip: Jump is adult only.

options.name: logic_gerudo_kitchen
options.text: Gerudo Fortress "Kitchen" with No Additional Items
options.tooltip:
The logic normally guarantees one of Bow, Hookshot,
or Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_deku_basement_gs
options.text: Deku Tree Basement Vines GS with Jump Slash
options.tooltip: Can be defeated by doing a precise jump slash.

options.name: logic_rusted_switches
options.tooltip:
Applies to:
- Fire Temple Highest Goron Chest.
- MQ Fire Temple Lizalfos Maze.
- MQ Spirit Trial.

options.name: logic_botw_basement
options.text: Bottom of the Well Basement Chest with Strength & Sticks
options.tooltip:
The chest in the basement can be reached with
strength by doing a jump slash with a lit
stick to access the bomb flowers.

options.name: logic_forest_mq_block_puzzle
options.text: Skip Forest Temple MQ Block Puzzle with Bombchu
options.tooltip:
Send the Bombchu straight up the center of the
wall directly to the left upon entering the room.

options.name: logic_spirit_child_bombchu
options.text: Spirit Temple Child Side Bridge with Bombchu
options.tooltip: A carefully-timed Bombchu can hit the switch.

options.name: logic_windmill_poh
options.text: Windmill PoH as Adult with Nothing
options.tooltip:
Can jump up to the spinning platform from
below as adult.

options.name: logic_crater_bean_poh_with_hovers
options.text: Crater's Bean PoH with Hover Boots
options.tooltip:
Hover from the base of the bridge
near Goron City and walk up the
very steep slope.

options.name: logic_zora_with_cucco
options.tooltip:
Can fly behind the waterfall with
a cucco as child.

options.name: logic_gtg_mq_with_hookshot
options.text: Gerudo Training Grounds MQ Left Side Silver Rupees with Hookshot
options.tooltip:
The highest silver rupee can be obtained by
hookshotting the target and then immediately jump
slashing toward the rupee.

options.name: logic_forest_vines
options.text: Forest Temple East Courtyard Vines with Hookshot
options.tooltip:
The vines in Forest Temple leading to where the well
drain switch is in the standard form can be barely
reached with just the Hookshot.

options.name: logic_forest_well_swim
options.text: Swim Through Forest Temple MQ Well with Hookshot
options.tooltip:
Shoot the vines in the well as low and as far to
the right as possible, and then immediately swim
under the ceiling to the right. This can only be
required if Forest Temple is in its Master Quest
form.

options.name: logic_dmt_bombable
options.text: Death Mountain Trail Bombable Chest with Strength
options.tooltip:
Child Link can blow up the wall using a nearby bomb
flower. You must backwalk with the flower and then
quickly throw it toward the wall.

options.name: logic_water_bk_chest
options.text: Water Temple Boss Key Chest with Iron Boots
options.tooltip:
Stand on the blue switch in the Stinger room with the
Iron Boots, wait for the water to rise all the way up,
and then swim straight to the exit. You should grab the
ledge as you surface. It works best if you don't mash B.

options.name: logic_adult_kokiri_gs
options.text: Adult Kokiri Forest GS with Hover Boots
options.tooltip:
Can be obtained without Hookshot by using the Hover
Boots off of one of the roots.

options.name: logic_spirit_mq_frozen_eye
options.text: Spirit Temple MQ Frozen Eye Switch without Fire
options.tooltip:
You can melt the ice by shooting an arrow through a
torch. The only way to find a line of sight for this
shot is to first spawn a Song of Time block, and then
stand on the very edge of it.

options.name: logic_spirit_wall
options.text: Spirit Temple Shifting Wall with No Additional Items
options.tooltip:
The logic normally guarantees a way of dealing with both
the Beamos and the Walltula before climbing the wall.

options.name: logic_spirit_lobby_gs
options.text: Spirit Temple Main Room GS with Boomerang
options.tooltip:
Standing on the highest part of the arm of the statue, a
precise Boomerang throw can kill and obtain this Gold
Skulltula. You must throw the Boomerang slightly off to
the side so that it curves into the Skulltula, as aiming
directly at it will clank off of the wall in front.

options.name: logic_spirit_mq_sun_block_gs
options.text: Spirit Temple MQ Sun Block Room GS with Boomerang
options.tooltip:
Throw the Boomerang in such a way that it
curves through the side of the glass block
to hit the Gold Skulltula.

options.name: logic_jabu_mq_sot_gs
options.text: Jabu MQ Song of Time Block GS with Boomerang
options.tooltip:
Allow the Boomerang to return to you through
the Song of Time block to grab the token.

options.name: logic_botw_mq_dead_hand_key
options.text: Bottom of the Well MQ Dead Hand Freestanding Key with Boomerang
options.tooltip:
Boomerang can fish the item out of the rubble without
needing explosives to blow it up.

options.name: logic_fire_flame_maze
options.text: Fire Temple Flame Wall Maze Skip
options.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of
a flame wall before it can rise up to block you.
To do it without taking damage is more precise.
Allows you to progress without needing either a
Small Key or Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_flame_maze
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Flame Wall Maze Skip
options.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of
a flame wall before it can rise up to block you.
To do it without taking damage is more precise.
Allows you to reach a GS without needing either
Song of Time or Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_near_boss
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Chest Near Boss without Breaking Crate
options.tooltip:
The hitbox for the torch extends a bit outside of the crate.
Shoot a flaming arrow at the side of the crate to light the
torch without needing to get over there and break the crate.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_maze_side_room
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Boulder Maze Side Room without Box
options.tooltip:
You can walk from the blue switch to the door and
quickly open the door before the bars reclose. This
skips needing the Hookshot in order to reach a box
to place on the switch.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_bk_chest
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Boss Key Chest without Bow
options.tooltip:
Din's alone can be used to unbar the door to
the boss key chest's room thanks to an
oversight in the way the game counts how many
torches have been lit.

options.name: logic_zora_river_lower
options.text: Zora's River Lower Freestanding PoH as Adult with Nothing
options.tooltip:
Adult can reach this PoH with a precise jump,
no Hover Boots required.

options.name: logic_water_cracked_wall_hovers
options.text: Water Temple Cracked Wall with Hover Boots
options.tooltip:
With a midair side-hop while wearing the Hover
Boots, you can reach the cracked wall without
needing to raise the water up to the middle level.

options.name: logic_shadow_freestanding_key
options.text: Shadow Temple Freestanding Key with Bombchu
options.tooltip:
Release the Bombchu with good timing so that
it explodes near the bottom of the pot.

options.name: logic_adult_meadow_access
options.text: Adult Meadow Access without Saria's or Minuet
options.tooltip:
With a specific position and angle, you can
backflip over Mido.

options.name: logic_volvagia_jump
options.text: Reach Volvagia without Hover Boots or Pillar
options.tooltip:
The Fire Temple Boss Door can be reached with a precise
jump. You must be touching the side wall of the room so
so that Link will grab the ledge from farther away than
is normally possible.

options.name: logic_lab_diving
options.text: Diving in the Lab without Gold Scale
options.tooltip:
Remove the Iron Boots in the midst of
Hookshotting the underwater crate.

options.name: logic_biggoron_bolero
options.text: Deliver Eye Drops with Bolero of Fire
options.tooltip:
If you do not wear the Goron Tunic, the heat timer
inside the crater will override the trade item's timer.
When you exit to Death Mountain Trail you will have
one second to deliver the Eye Drops before the timer
expires. It works best if you play Bolero as quickly as
possible upon receiving the Eye Drops. If you have few
hearts, there is enough time to dip Goron City to
refresh the heat timer as long as you've already
pulled the block.

options.name: logic_wasteland_crossing
options.text: Wasteland Crossing without Hover Boots or Longshot
options.tooltip:
You can beat the quicksand by backwalking across it
in a specific way.

options.name: logic_colossus_gs
options.text: Desert Colossus Hill GS with Hookshot
options.tooltip:
Somewhat precise. If you kill enough Leevers
you can get enough of a break to take some time
to aim more carefully.

options.name: logic_dc_scarecrow_gs
options.text: Dodongo's Cavern Scarecrow GS with Armos Statue
options.tooltip:
You can jump off an Armos Statue to reach the
alcove with the Gold Skulltula. It takes quite
a long time to pull the statue the entire way.
The jump to the alcove can be a pit picky when
done as child.

options.name: logic_kakariko_tower_gs
options.text: Kakariko Tower GS with Jump Slash
options.tooltip:
Climb the tower as high as you can without
touching the Gold Skulltula, then let go and
jump slash immediately. You will take fall
damage.

options.name: logic_lab_wall_gs
options.text: Lake Hylia Lab Wall GS with Jump Slash
options.tooltip:
The jump slash to actually collect the
token is somewhat precise.

options.name: logic_spirit_mq_lower_adult
options.text: Spirit Temple MQ Lower Adult without Fire Arrows
options.tooltip:
It can be done with Din's Fire and Bow.
Whenever an arrow passes through a lit torch, it
resets the timer. It's finicky but it's also
possible to stand on the pillar next to the center
torch, which makes it easier.

options.name: logic_spirit_map_chest
options.text: Spirit Temple Map Chest with Bow
options.tooltip:
To get a line of sight from the upper torch to
the map chest torches, you must pull an Armos
statue all the way up the stairs.

options.name: logic_spirit_sun_chest
options.text: Spirit Temple Sun Block Room Chest with Bow
options.tooltip:
Using the blocks in the room as platforms you can
get lines of sight to all three torches. The timer
on the torches is quite short so you must move
quickly in order to light all three.

options.name: logic_forest_outdoors_ledge
options.text: Forest Temple NE Outdoors Ledge with Hover Boots
options.tooltip:
With precise Hover Boots movement you can fall down
to this ledge from upper balconies. If done precisely
enough, it is not necessary to take fall damage.
In MQ, this skips a Longshot requirement.
In Vanilla, this can skip a Hookshot requirement in
entrance randomizer.

options.name: logic_water_boss_key_region
options.text: Water Temple Boss Key Region with Hover Boots
options.tooltip:
With precise Hover Boots movement it is possible
to reach the boss key chest's region without
needing the Longshot. It is not necessary to take
damage from the spikes. The Gold Skulltula Token
in the following room can also be obtained with
just the Hover Boots.

options.name: logic_water_falling_platform_gs
options.text: Water Temple Falling Platform Room GS with Hookshot
options.tooltip:
If you stand on the very edge of the platform, this
Gold Skulltula can be obtained with only the Hookshot.

options.name: logic_crater_upper_to_lower
options.text: Death Mountain Crater Upper to Lower with Hammer
options.tooltip:
With the Hammer, you can jumpslash the rock twice
in the same jump in order to destroy it before you
fall into the lava.

options.name: logic_zora_with_hovers
options.text: Zora's Domain Entry with Hover Boots
options.tooltip: Can hover behind the waterfall as adult.

options.name: logic_shadow_statue
options.text: Shadow Temple River Statue with Bombchu
options.tooltip:
By sending a Bombchu around the edge of the
gorge, you can knock down the statue without
needing a Bow.
Applies in both vanilla and MQ Shadow.

options.name: logic_link_goron_dins
options.text: Stop Link the Goron with Din's Fire
options.tooltip: The timing is quite awkward.

options.name: logic_fire_song_of_time
options.text: Fire Temple Song of Time Room GS without Song of Time
options.tooltip: A precise jump can be used to reach this room.

options.name: logic_fire_strength
options.tooltip:
A precise jump can be used to skip
pushing the block.

options.name: logic_fire_mq_bombable_chest
options.text: Fire Temple MQ Big Lava Room Bombable Chest without Hookshot
options.tooltip:
A precisely-angled jump can get over the wall
of fire in this room. It's expected that you
will take damage as you do this. As it may
take multiple attempts, you won't be expected
to use a fairy to survive.

options.name: logic_light_trial_mq
options.tooltip:
If you move quickly you can sneak past the edge of
a flame wall before it can rise up to block you.
In this case it doesn't seem possible to do it
without taking damage.

options.name: logic_ice_mq_scarecrow
options.text: Ice Cavern MQ Scarecrow GS with No Additional Items
options.tooltip: A precise jump can be used to reach this alcove.

settings.tooltip: Select the earliest item that can appear in the adult trade sequence.
settings.name: logic_earliest_adult_trade

settings.tooltip: Select the latest item that can appear in the adult trade sequence.
settings.name: logic_latest_adult_trade

settings.tooltip:
'Required everywhere': every invisible or
fake object will expect you to have the
Lens of Truth and Magic. The exception is
passing through the first wall in Bottom of
the Well, since that is required in vanilla.

'Wasteland': The lens is needed to follow
the ghost guide across the Haunted Wasteland.
settings.name: logic_lens

settings.tooltip:
The tower escape sequence between
Ganondorf and Ganon will be skipped.
settings.name: no_escape_sequence

settings.tooltip:
The crawlspace into Hyrule Castle goes
straight to Zelda, skipping the guards.
settings.name: no_guard_stealth

settings.tooltip:
Epona can be summoned with Epona's Song
without needing to race Ingo.
settings.name: no_epona_race

settings.tooltip:
The cutscenes of the Poes in Forest Temple,
Darunia in Fire Temple, and the introduction
to Twinrova will not be skipped.
settings.name: useful_cutscenes

settings.tooltip:
All chest animations are fast. If disabled,
the animation time is slow for major items.
settings.name: fast_chests

settings.tooltip:
GS Tokens that can only be obtained
during the night expect you to have Sun's
Song to collect them. This prevents needing
to wait until night for some locations.
settings.name: logic_no_night_tokens_without_suns_song

settings.tooltip:
Pulling out the Ocarina near a
spot at which Pierre can spawn will
do so, without needing the song.
settings.name: free_scarecrow

settings.tooltip:
Start the game with Prelude of Light,
Serenade of Water, and Farore's Wind.

Two song locations will give items,
instead of Prelude and Serenade.
settings.name: start_with_fast_travel

settings.tooltip: Start the game with 99 rupees. Wallet upgrades fill wallet.
settings.name: start_with_rupees

settings.tooltip: Start the game with the largest wallet (999 max).
settings.name: start_with_wallet

settings.tooltip:
Start the game with 10 Deku sticks and 20 Deku nuts.
Additionally, start the game with a Deku shield equipped,
unless playing with the Shopsanity setting.
settings.name: start_with_deku_equipment

settings.tooltip: Moves all except the Chicken near the pen into the pen.
settings.name: fast_chickens

settings.tooltip:
The Poe buyer will give a reward for turning
in a random number of Big Poes.
settings.name: big_poe_count_random

settings.tooltip:
The Poe buyer will give a reward for turning
in the chosen number of Big Poes.
settings.name: big_poe_count

settings.tooltip:
Will need to memorize a new set of songs.
Can be silly, but difficult. Songs are
generally sensible, and warp songs are
typically more difficult.
settings.name: ocarina_songs

settings.tooltip:
Chests will be large if they contain a major
item and small if they don't. Boss keys will
be in gold chests. This allows skipping
chests if they are small. However, skipping
small chests will mean having low health,
ammo, and rupees, so doing so is a risk.
settings.name: correct_chest_sizes

settings.tooltip:
The hints provided by Gossip Stones will
be very direct if this option is enabled.
settings.name: clearer_hints

settings.tooltip:
Gossip Stones can be made to give hints
about where items can be found.

Different settings can be chosen to
decide which item is needed to
speak to Gossip Stones. Choosing to
stick with the Mask of Truth will
make the hints very difficult to
obtain.

Hints for 'on the way of the hero' are
locations that contain items that are
required to beat the game.
settings.name: hints

settings.tooltip:
Useless has nothing but junk hints.
Strong distribution has a good
spread of different hint types.
Multiworld distribution has only
a few specific, useful hint types.
Tournament distribution has a set
number of hints for each type.
settings.name: hint_dist

settings.tooltip:
Will make things confusing for comedic value.

'Shuffled except Hints and Keys': Key texts
are not shuffled because in keysanity it is
inconvenient to figure out which keys are which
without the correct text. Similarly, non-shop
items sold in shops will also retain standard
text for the purpose of accurate price checks.
settings.name: text_shuffle

settings.tooltip:
Off: All Ice Traps are removed.
Normal: Only Ice Traps from the base item pool
are placed.
Extra Ice Traps: Chance to add extra Ice Traps
when junk items are added to the itempool.
Ice Trap Mayhem: All added junk items will
be Ice Traps.
Ice Trap Onslaught: All junk items will be
replaced by Ice Traps, even those in the
base pool.
settings.name: junk_ice_traps

settings.tooltip:
Changes the amount of bonus items that
are available in the game.

'Plentiful': Extra major items are added.

'Balanced': Original item pool.

'Scarce': Some excess items are removed,
including health upgrades.

'Minimal': Most excess items are removed.
settings.name: item_pool_value

settings.tooltip:
Changes the amount of damage taken.

'OHKO': Link dies in one hit.
settings.name: damage_multiplier

settings.tooltip:
Change up Link's sleep routine.

Daytime officially starts at 6:30,
nighttime at 18:00 (6:00 PM).

Default is 10:00 in the morning.
The alternatives are multiples of 3 hours.
settings.name: starting_tod

settings.tooltip:
Choose which age Link will start as.

Starting as adult means you start with
the master sword in your inventory.

Only the child option is compatible with
Closed Forest.
settings.name: starting_age
